attributes.action: Ensure that terrorists do not get state pensions.
attributes.additional_details:
Corbyn’s amendment is also backed by fellow Labour MPs Karin Smyth, Tony Lloyd and Nick Brown.
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/9522203/jeremy-corbyn-law-pension-ira-terrorists/
attributes.background: Jeremy Corbyn is pushing for a law change that could hand pensions to terrorists. He has put his name to an amendment to the Northern Ireland (Executive Formation) bill. It demands a pension for all “seriously injured victims of Troubles-related incidents”. It may allow terrorists to claim handouts

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

The Northern Ireland (Executive Formation etc) Act 2019 has placed a legal duty on the UK Government to introduce a victims payments scheme by the end of May 2020.

The Northern Ireland Office has said that it will consult widely on the details of a scheme before it is implemented. It has also said that the intention of the scheme would be to support people seriously injured in Troubles-related incidents through no fault of their own, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
